#Text=Juan Nepomucino Goetz
#Text=Juan Nepomucino Goetz ( German : Johannes Nepomuk Goetz ) was an Austrian Catholic priest whose arrival in Cuba led to two extraordinary controversies .

#Text=Goetz became Professor of Philosophy and Morality at the Imperial and Royal University of Vienna , and then , desiring to travel , was appointed music chaplain of the Cathedral of Santo Domingo in Hispaniola ( Dominican Republic ) .
#Text=Later , as priest and rector , he moves to San Fernando de Monte Cristi , and then to the wealthy parish of Môle Saint-Nicolas in Haiti .
#Text=There he witnessed the slave uprising and the occupation of his parish by the British .
#Text=When Toussaint-Louverture drives out the British he rings the church bells and celebrates .
#Text=But , all too soon ! War flares up throughout the country , voodoo drums throb through the night , and white faces are none too popular .
#Text=Deprived of alms and suffering from yellow fever , Goetz flees to Santiago de Cuba , where his knowledge of languages gives him a place as the ' foreigners ' priest . [ 1 ]
#Text=Goetz in Santiago de Cuba
#Text=When Esteban Salas y Castro , choirmaster in the Cathedral of Santiago de Cuba , died in 1803 , the election of the new Maestro de Capilla was an extraordinary event .
#Text=It had been a foregone conclusion that Francisco José Hierrezuelo , long-time assistant of Salas , would be elected .
#Text=Came the day , and Hierrezuelo spotted a certain well-qualified German priest in the choir .
#Text=Blind with rage , and fearing the bishop had planned a conspiracy to thwart him , Hierrezuelo refused to take the examination , picked up his pen and wrote infuriated letters .

#Text=The bishop persuaded the German , none other than Goetz , to renounce his candidacy , but Hierrezuelo had so offended the bishop and the town council by his irate letters that , despite grovelling apologies , he got only a minor position in the chapel .
#Text=He was never to become maestro .
#Text=The competent and hard-working Juan París was appointed , and Goetz moved on to Havana , where his arrival also had remarkable consequences .
#Text=Goetz in Havana
#Text=In Havana at the same time , the choirmaster , Lazo de la Vega , was ailing , and died .

#Text=Upon his death four men sought the post : 28-year-old first violinist José Francisco Rensoli , singer Luis Lazo , maestro Cayetano Solis and the Catalan Cayetano Pagueras , a religious composer and first contralto .
#Text=The matter was to be decided by competitive examination .
#Text=Pagueras was a strong candidate , regarding himself as a maestro in four arts : plainsong , organ playing , counterpoint and composition .
#Text=All were set for the examination when a letter , written on 29 July 1803 , arrived at the cathedral .
#Text=It was from Goetz , offering his service .
#Text=Great was the consternation amongst the rivals when they discovered that the town council had invited Goetz to Havana so they could learn more about his merits .
#Text=Goetz arrived in Havana at the beginning of November 1803 , having applied for naturalization as a Spanish subject .
#Text=Later that month , the town council , duly impressed with his competence , appointed him interim holder of the desired position .
#Text=Pagueras and Rensoli set out to make his work as difficult as possible .
#Text=" When Goetz appeared before the choir , he was surrounded by pale , half-scared smiles " ( Carpentier , p136 ) .
#Text=After looking , listening and questioning , he wrote a first report to the town council full of acute assessments of key members of the choir :
#Text=" Cayetano Pagueras : Second contralto , terrible voice , no expressiveness .
#Text=Knows nothing of music , and never will .
#Text=He entered the chapel fraudulently , and ... is totally inept ; superfluous .
#Text=" " Don Juan Alcayado : Third tenor .
#Text=Terrible voice .
#Text=He hardly attends , and when he does , he speaks constantly , disturbing the others ...
#Text=A totally useless human being .
#Text=The position of third tenor is hereby abolished for its superfluousness .
#Text=" [ 2 ]
